bibl.title: Letter from William C. Borden to the Adjutant General, November 23, 1902

div1.p: Borden announces the time and cause of Reed's death. Endorsements by O'Reilly are included. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from William C. Borden to the Adjutant General, November 23, 1902
div1.opener:
U. S. A. General Hospital,
WASHINGTON BARRACKS.
Washington, D. C., November 23" 1902
To the
Adjutant General
U. S. Army,
Washington D.C.
Through Surgeon General, U. S. A.
Sir:
div1.p:
In compliance with paragraph 93 A.R., it becomes my painful duty
to advise you of the death of Major Walter Reed, Surgeon U. S. Army at this
hospital at five minutes after two O'clock A.M., this date.
Primary cause of death, was Acute appendicitis,
Immediate cause of death, was Asthenia.

SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE.
November 24, 1902.
Respectfully forwarded to the
ADJUTANT GENERAL, U. S. ARMY.
The death of Major Reed is a heavy
blow to the Army and to American
Medical Science.
His services have already proved
almost priceless to the nation, and
had he been spared even more might
have been expected of him. His
qualities as a man so endeared him
to his associates that they feel
his loss as a personal calamity.
R M O'Reilly
Surgeon General, U. S. Army.
